item.title: 5 minute tidyverse: ggplot2
item.description: R’s ggplot2 package allows for plots to be built up in layers. It ties in nicely with the tidyverse’s “tidy” way of structuring data, allowing different aesthetics of a plot to be controlled by variables in a data frame. An online reference is available from ggplot2.tidyverse.org/reference/. Geoms and aesthetics A typical ggplot2 function takes the following form: library(tidyverse) ggplot(diamonds, aes(x = carat, y = price, colour = clarity)) + geom_point() The initial ggplot call specifies the data frame to be used and the aesthetic mappings.
